byline.original: By MICHAEL S. SCHMIDT and TIM ARANGO
byline.contributor: Thom Shanker and Helene Cooper contributed reporting from Washington.

abstract: Obama administration's proposal to keep a few thousand American troops in Iraq after 2011 to train Iraqi troops is being scaled back after American officials conclude that Iraqi lawmakers will not grant legal protections for remaining American troops.
snippet: Plans to keep some American troops in Iraq to train its military after the end of the year are being scaled back over a lack of legal immunity for the troops, officials said.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces

lead_paragraph: Plans to keep some American troops in Iraq to train its military after the end of the year are being scaled back over a lack of legal immunity for the troops, officials said.

headline.main: U.S. Cuts Back the Proposed Size of Its Force in Iraq
headline.print_headline: U.S. Cuts Back Proposed Size Of Force in Iraq
headline.seo: U.S. Cuts Back Proposed Size of Force in Iraq
